articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Voter suppression concerns weigh heavy on Georgia voters
articles.description: Derrick Johnson, president of the NAACP, talks with MSNBC's Trymaine Lee about frustrations among Georgia voters over long lines and other obstacles to casting their vote today.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Lawsuit requests to remove Brian Kemp from overseeing Georgia Governor race
articles.description: Ari Melber reports on a late-breaking lawsuit "trying to remove Brian Kemp from overseeing the rest of this election" in Georgia.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Democrats look to draw support of independents with key issues
articles.description: Senator Amy Klobuchar talks about why she thinks Democrats have a strong chance of drawing the support of Midwest cross-over voters and independents with their emphasis on health care and other quality of life issues.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Large swath of 2018 voters doing so for the first time
articles.description: Early exit polls in the 2018 election shows that 16% of the voters are doing so for the first time, with a disproportionate amount of those people falling on the Democratic side of the spectrum.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Exit Poll: Health care replaces economy as most important issue for voters
articles.description: Early results from the NBC News Exit Poll indicate that Democrats’ strategic decision to campaign on the issue of health care resonated with voters. When asked which of four issues was the most important facing the country, a 41 percent plurality said health …

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: RNC Chair: Economic message doesn't 'move needle as much' with...
articles.description: Republican National Committee Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel explains why Trump may have elected to go with a closing message focused on immigration rather than the economy.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: RNC Chair: ‘It’s going to be a late night I think’
articles.description: RNC Chairwoman Ronna McDaniel joins MTP Daily to discuss the Republicans’ chances tonight and whether President Trump’s midterm closing message will help the Republican Party.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: DNC Chair: Healthcare ‘will be an important part of our victory today’
articles.description: DNC Chairman Tom Perez joins MTP Daily to discuss the chances of a Democratic blue wave tonight and what the Democratic message should be.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Tuesday's Mini-Report, 11.6.18
articles.description: Today's edition of quick hits.
articles.content: Today’s edition of quick hits: * Every darn cycle : Malfunctioning machines, voter confusion and locked polling sites were among the problems on Election Day as millions of Americans prepared to cast ballots Tuesday in a midterm election fueling an outpouring… [+2204 chars]

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Morning Joe 11/06/18
articles.description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.
articles.content: Morning Joe 11/06/18 Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Morning Joe full episodes

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Wisconsin voter: ‘There’s a fire under people to get out and vote’
articles.description: Madison, Wisconsin voter Joe Niesen, says that healthcare is a big reason he came to the polls.  Niesen thinks that because of the large amount of “hot button” issues there is a fire under people to get out and vote, bringing a large number of people to the p…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One More Thing: Don’t let misinformation get in the way of your vote
articles.description: In some cases, social media is helping to spread election misinformation. For verified sources to find information you need to vote, go to vote411.org or ballotready.org.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: All eyes on Georgia Gubernatorial race
articles.description: After a slew of partisan fights, accusations of voter suppression, and even a few lawsuits, voters in Georgia are casting their ballots today to choose the next Governor.  Will it be Democrat Stacey Abrams, or Republican Brian Kemp?

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: President Trump feeling confident heading into the midterm elections
articles.description: Former RNC Chairman, Michael Steele and Former Advisor to Bill Clinton's Campaign, James Carville join Katy Tur to talk about Trump’s impact on the GOP ahead of the midterms. Carville says Trump has made himself the issue this election.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The Big Question: What's going to happen next?
articles.description: With 470 Congressional seats up for grabs, and 38 million votes cast before polls even opened this morning, some are calling today’s midterm elections the most important in a lifetime. What will the results be?

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: PA voters hit the polls in ‘bellwether’ race for control of House
articles.description: NBC’s Anne Thompson joins Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle from Pennsylvania’s new first Congressional district, to discuss how the redrawn districts are affecting voters.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Minnesota voters explain why Democrats have their vote
articles.description: Incumbent Jason Lewis (R) is facing quite a challenge from Angie Craig (D) in the midterm elections. Voters in Minnesota describe how they voted, and say they want their grandchildren to grow up in a better world. Healthcare and GOP tax cuts are among the iss…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Which states could give us early indications of midterm results?
articles.description: Watch Stephanie Ruhle and Ali Velshi discuss which key races could give us early indications of results nationwide and break down which bellwether races could be decided in just a few hours.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Election Day misinformation to look out for
articles.description: One of the most pressing issues this election year is voter suppression. Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle tell you what to look for, no matter where you live, and what you can do to make sure your vote counts. MSNBC Legal Analyst Maya Wiley weighs in.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How many educators are running for office?
articles.description: Triple the number of current and former educators who usually run in an election cycle are on the ballot for midterms this year.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Hundreds of candidates with science backgrounds running for office
articles.description: Watch Ali Velshi and Stephanie Ruhle share how many candidates are running for office in the midterm elections that have science backgrounds.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How many veterans are running for Congress?
articles.description: No matter what state you live in, your right to vote is not a given. Over hundreds of years, countless people fought and died for that right – and some of them risked their lives to be on the ballots today. Watch Stephanie Ruhle and Ali Velshi break down how …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: You can register to vote on election day in 15 states and DC
articles.description: Fifteen states and the District of Columbia offer same-day voter registration, meaning you can show up to the polls, register to vote, and cast a ballot today. If you haven’t registered to vote, but live in one of these places – go vote!

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Georgia’s election protection group seeing voter confidence after court order
articles.description: MSNBC’s Trymaine Lee speaks with ProGeorgia’s Tamieka Atkins on Election Day about voter confidence following Brian Kemp’s suppression claims.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: John Lewis with inspirational message on election day
articles.description: Georgia Democratic Congressman and Civil Rights Activist, John Lewis, advocates for young voters to head to the polls on Andrea Mitchell Reports.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Flubbing logic, Trump boasts, 'I've kept more promises than I've made'
articles.description: "I've actually kept more promises than I've made," he said. "When did you ever hear that from a politician?" Never, because it's literally impossible.
articles.content: Donald Trump has delivered more speeches in recent days than he’s accustomed to giving, and the fatigue may have taken a toll on his messaging. For example, this was part of the president’s pitch in Cleveland last night: Promises made, promises kept. You know… [+1543 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Democrats are looking to flip key Minnesota house seat
articles.description: Democrats in Minnesota are looking to flip key house seat on election day.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Tuesday's Campaign Round-Up, 11.6.18
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content: Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country. * Gallup doesn’t do a lot of horse-race polling anymore, but its final pre-election survey found Democrats leading Republicans on the generic congressional ballot, 54% to 43%, among l… [+1543 chars]

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: After two terms as governor, LePage...
articles.description: Maine Gov Paul LePage (R) appears to be running away from the state he's helped lead for eight years.
articles.content: It wasn’t long ago when Maine Gov. Paul LePage (R), eyeing the end of his two terms as the state’s chief executive, announced his intention to run against Sen. Angus King (I). Facing inevitable defeat, the governor later backed off. So, if Congress isn’t the … [+1527 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will the midterms be a wave or a realigning?
articles.description: Andrea Mitchell, David Wasserman and Bob Woodward join Morning Joe to discuss midterm polling, including what states they're watching closely, anti-Semitism used this campaign season on the right and the Latino vote.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Joe: Trump WH is spreading preposterous lies
articles.description: Joe Scarborough tackles the president's remarks about immigrants and the Democrats as well as Sean Hannity's tweet that he wouldn't campaign with the president.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: On jobs, Republicans pick the wrong fight at the wrong time
articles.description: The question for Lindsey Graham and other Trump sycophants remains the same: why was the job market stronger across much of Obama's second term than it is now?
articles.content: Over the weekend, Ronna Romney McDaniel, the chair of the Republican National Committee, proclaimed that the economy is adding more jobs per month under Donald Trump than under Barack Obama. To arrive at this, the RNC chair had to play a misleading game: she … [+3124 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Suburban Detroit voters speak on key election issues
articles.description: MSNBC’s Mariana Atencio speaks to voters at a polling location in Troy, Michigan, gauging their top national and local issues of concern.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘It will mean so much’ if Beto wins: Texas voter
articles.description: 77-year-old Pamela Aguirre tears up after voting in El Paso, Texas.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Midterm elections & the historical indicators that follow
articles.description: The midterms are a political tradition that goes back to 1790. Watch Stephanie Ruhle break down the history of the midterm election and how history can give us a hint of what’s coming next.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Bad GOP choices will help Dems take House: Jim Messina
articles.description: Valerie Jarrett and Jim Messina both served under President Obama, and they join Morning Joe to assess where the Democrats are going into the 2018 midterms. Jeff Greenfield also joins the discussion.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Trump's amusing new warning: Dems might 'obliterate Obamacare'
articles.description: Donald Trump really did warn an audience in Missouri last night, "The Democrat plan would obliterate Obamacare."
articles.content: Republican audiences have heard Donald Trump repeat a standard line in his 2018 stump speech: If Democrats gain power, they’ll also be planning a takeover of American health care and that would be socialism, what they want to do. The Democrat plan would oblit… [+1832 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Joe's appeal to voters: The power is in your hands
articles.description: The Morning Joe panel shares their final thoughts on Tuesday, November 6, 2018.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: White House ally sees Team Trump's...
articles.description: Several members of Trump's inner circle have been indicted on a variety of felonies -- but Obama apparently isn't supposed to talk or joke about it.
articles.content: At a campaign event in Wisconsin a couple of weeks ago, Barack Obama took a moment to reflect on what Donald Trump and his team promised the nation two years ago, and compare that to what the Republican administration has delivered. They promised to take on c… [+1834 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: NRCC makes predictions for volatile midterms
articles.description: Matt Gorman of the National Republican Congressional Committee joins Morning Joe to discuss where the GOP is on Election Day for the midterms.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: DCCC chair emphasizes Dems position on immigration
articles.description: DCCC Chair, Rep. Ben Ray Luján, D-NM, discusses the midterms, why he says Democrats stand for the people and the Dems' position on immigration.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Matthews on the importance of Midterms 2018
articles.description: Chris says tonight's vote is about whether you like the way things are going well with Trump or not.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Is Trump's pitch to women too little too late?
articles.description: With Democrats enjoying more support from women voters than Republicans, the president made a last-minute pitch to women during a rally on Monday by bringing out Kellyanne Conway, Sarah Huckabee Sanders and daughter Ivanka. But is it too little too late?

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Why Trump took a renewed interest in Barack Obama's middle name
articles.description: Trump needed an issue to motivate GOP voters. He chose the one topic he sees as a life-preserver intended to rescue Republican candidates.
articles.content: The U.S. Senate race in Indiana this year is among this year’s most competitive and closely watched contests, so it wasn’t surprising to learn that Donald Trump would travel to Indianapolis to rally support for Mike Braun (R), ahead of Barack Obama’s visit to… [+2199 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Steve Kornacki breaks down the latest polling
articles.description: Steve Kornacki breaks down the latest midterm polling on Election Day from the Kentucky and Virginia House races to the Indiana Senate fight.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump goes out there for himself ahead of midterms
articles.description: Tuesday is Election Day, and will the Dems pick up the 23 seats in the House needed to take control? Why on the final day did Trump rally with Rush Limbaugh and Sean Hannity and potentially turn off swing voters? The Morning Joe panel discusses.

articles.title: Episode three of Rachel Maddow's Bag Man podcast now available
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reminds viewers of Tuesday's special coverage of election day beginning at 6pm ET, and announces that Episode Three of her podcast, Bag Man, is now available for listening.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Democratic gains require overcoming extreme GOP gerrymandering
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at data compiled by the Brennan Center for Justice that shows much Democrats have to over-perform in elections in order to pick up legislative seats.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Virginia, Florida could set stage for midterm election's outcome
articles.description: Patrick Murray, director of the Monmouth University Polling Institute, talks with Rachel Maddow about key elections early in the 2018 tallying that could point to how the rest of the night (or week or month) will play out.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP retirements pushed by grassroots activists widened 2018 field
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on the activism of Indivisible groups across the United States and points out how many of the open seats in the 2018 election are seats left by Republicans who retired under pressure from protesters.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: North Miami voters wait hours, determined to cast 2018 votes
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on the determination of voters in North Miami who stood in line for hours to vote at a polling location named for a woman who famously embodied that same democratic determination.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fate of Congress could be in California's hands
articles.description: Jacob Soboroff, correspondent for MSNBC, reports live from the registrar's headquarters in Orange County, California, on preparations for a large turnout of voters and how long it could take for the final results of 2018 to be known.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Keep track of 2018 turnover with Vulnerable Incumbent Bingo
articles.description: Rachel Maddow offers viewers a bingo card featuring the most endangered incumbents in the 2018 election according to FiveThirtyEight.com to help keep track 2018 election outcomes.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump ends midterm campaign with an 'Us' vs. 'Them' narrative
articles.description: The president took a dark tone and ended his midterm campaign by pitting his supporters against Democrats. Jeremy Peters joins to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Steve Kornacki breaks down whether Dems can take back the Senate
articles.description: Could Democrats take control of the Senate in the midterms? Steve Kornacki breaks down the possibilities.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will Trump's White House see a shake-up after midterm elections?
articles.description: Are staff changes likely to hit the West Wing after the midterm election is over and done with? Philip Rucker of The Washington Post reacts.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Falsehoods & fear from Trump in final hours of midterm campaign
articles.description: During his final rallies before America votes on November 6, Trump told voters to vote as if he were on the ballot. But is that going to help or hurt Republicans trying to hang on to control of Congress? Philip Rucker, Sabrina Siddiqui, & Shannon Pettypiece j…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump pushes white identity politics but what about everyone else?
articles.description: Trump keeps pushing anti-immigrant rhetoric to fire-up his mostly-white base but many Republicans are concerned the rhetoric could help Democrats. Lawrence discusses with Ezra Klein.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Ryan begs Trump to talk economy, instead Trump talks fear
articles.description: President Donald Trump continues to campaign on fear of immigrants before the midterm election in spite of a plea from house speaker Paul Ryan. Election Night expectations? Lawrence discusses with Maria Teresa Kumar, Michael Steele, and Jennifer Palmieri.

articles.title: Michael Moore: Get other people to vote
articles.description: “Everybody has to be in the game” on election day, says Oscar-winning filmmaker Michael Moore. “Call in sick, blame it on me.”

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Maxine Waters on the historic midterm elections
articles.description: “It’s all because of the Trump party that I think we’re winning in these deeply conservative districts," Rep. Maxine Waters tells Chris Hayes.

articles.title: Rebecca Traister on first midterms of the #MeToo era
articles.description: Rebecca Traister, author of "Good and Mad," has seen women mobilize nationwide for the first midterm elections in the #MeToo era.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Stacey Abrams slams Brian Kemp for ‘abusing powers’ in Georgia
articles.description: Georgia Democratic gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams said Monday that her Republican opponent, Brian Kemp, was abusing his power as secretary of state to conduct a last-minute "witch hunt" into the state's Democratic Party.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Cher on Trump: I don’t understand how we’re America anymore
articles.description: With the midterm elections coming up on Tuesday, Cher is urging voters to make sure their voice is heard.
